content: Hey folks! So in principle we need a lang team liaison. I'm not sure who that should be -- I think we should clarify how much of a role we really expect to need. I'd be ok with being someone that can be pinged when stuff arises, and we will typically do monthyl check-ins on progress, but I don't think I can offer much in the way of following along with threads or discussions.
Are there other @T-lang folks who would be interested in doing more?

@nikomatsakis Given recent discussions about the liaison role, it seems worth confirming: does this need to be a @T-lang member, or could we potentially have someone else fill the role and provide semi-regular updates for us?
Yeah, I was thinking about that too.
I don't know :)

I've been debating in my head how liaisons fit into the proposed alternative structure, but I still think it largely makes sense that every active lang team project should have somebody who is supposed to be the rep from the lang team proper, though I think that rep doesn't necessarily have to be super active in the discussions.
Liaison != lead, in other words
We should take this to another thread rather than the one specific to this project.
Agreed
Has there been an official liason assigned yet? If so, should they be included in the project-group team file?
No, and yes!
I think I'd be willing to liaison this
Though it might be better to find someone else
Josh and I were planning to do a meeting and go over projects and things
Note that per the initiative process, this would be in the Experimentation phase, which means it's fine to land code, though we want to mark the feature gate as experimental

nikomatsakis said:

I think I'd be willing to liaison this

Alright. Until it's resolved, should I just list you in members/leads for the project-group file?
@Connor Horman Yes. That implies that we should setup a monthly meeting :)
The other question is who is the owner
I am assuming that you are interested, @Connor Horman?
If so, I'd like to touch base on that at some point, to talk through the role
Yes, I can probably take that role.
(One of the things I want to do is to be intentional and careful about who we pick for owners, since the new process gives some substantial weight to the role)

Update here: after discussing with @nikomatsakis, I've assigned myself as lang team liason on this issue. Please feel free to message me with any questions or let me know if there're other ways I can assist with progress here! I'll do my best to stay up-to-date with the discussion and will plan to check-in every once in a while. Thanks for all y'all's efforts to get this feature going! I'm excited for this improvement to pattern-matching :)
